intro: Morinda nanlingensis var. pilophora, commonly known as the Nanling mountain glorybower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in a fine, soft pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
